content:
I think I'm getting close, but I still need a bit more information to pinpoint the exact location.

Since you mentioned watching the snow melt away on March 1st, I'm going to take a guess that you're located in the eastern Sierra Nevada range, possibly near the California-Nevada border. This region tends to have a more moderate climate, with colder winters and warmer springs, which fits with your description.

Am I getting warmer?

If I'm correct, I can suggest some amazing scenic drives and hiking trails in the eastern Sierra Nevada range, including the Mammoth Lakes area, Mono Lake, and the June Lake Loop. Let me know if I'm on the right track!
